If the cluster has been upgraded then this might be adding a hidden alias on a non-hidden index. Is that a problem? (Maybe not - as long as you’re sure I’m good to merge this.)
For example, suppose a user runs ML in 7.6.1 and so has a non-hidden .ml-anomalies-shared index. Then they upgrade to 7.7 and create another job that uses the shared results index.
(This also makes me realise that before 7.last we’ll need another PR that makes pre-existing indices and aliases hidden. But that’s not critical for 7.7.)

nodes.bodyText:
If the cluster has been upgraded then this might be adding a hidden alias on a non-hidden index. Is that a problem? (Maybe not - as long as you’re sure I’m good to merge this.)

I've verified that in 7.7 hidden alias can point at a non-hidden index so it's not a problem.
Gordon confirmed that all four combinations ({hidden, visible} x {index, alias}) should work fine so there should not be any BWC issues while upgrading from 7.6 to 7.7.

This also makes me realise that before 7.last we’ll need another PR that makes pre-existing indices and aliases hidden. But that’s not critical for 7.7.

I've just created tracking issue for that: #53674
